metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: PRE 10 10

config.question: What was the underlying reason for the South Carolinians’ attack on the protective tariff?

choices.content: They used the issue of the tariff to register their real grievance, against encroaching federal power.
Most of them were Republicans, and they thought imposing tariffs was essential for the economic development of the state.
France and Britain had imposed duties on imports from South Carolina.
They were engaged in a continuing trade battle with Dutch merchants.

answer_3.response: South Carolina, like other slave states, was concerned about federal attacks on the institution of slavery. Opposition to the tariff challenged federal power without bringing up the issue of slavery.
